bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, March 12, 1940

div1.p: Hench provides details of a planned trip to Palm Beach, Florida and Havana, Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, March 12, 1940
div1.opener:
March 12, 1940
Mr. John J. Moran
Compania Sunoco De Cuba, S. A.
Avenida Menocal Nos. 455-457
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
I was delighted to have your letter. I had planned to leave this Friday,
the fifteenth, for Florida, but my boy has been sick in the hospital and our date
for leaving has been unsettled. However, it now looks as if we would be able to
get away on the fifteenth, arriving at the Villa Atlantique, Atlantic Avenue,
Palm Beach, Florida, on Sunday, March seventeenth. We will be there for a month
except for the time spent in Havana.

If it is comfortable in Palm Beach, we will probably not come to Havana
until about the first or second week in April, but if it is cold in Palm Beach,
we may come earlier. I shall appreciate your writing me a letter at the above
address in Palm Beach, stating whether there is any particular time that is
more convenient for you than some other. I am hoping that we may be able to
spend four or five days in Havana, one or two of which I should like to spend
with you, or as much time as you can allow. I am anxious to rent a car, and
if you are willing, to have you take me to the site of the old camp where the
yellow fever work was done. Perhaps I am asking too much, and you will be unable
to do this, but I hope you can do it. In addition, I will have many questions to
ask you, which may take part of another day. I only hope I will not be intruding
on too much of your time.

We have twice stayed at the Sevilla-Biltmore, and we thought we would
like to stay at the Hotel National this time. I am writing them, making a tenta-
tive reservation for Monday, April 8. Perhaps we had better land in Havana on a
Sunday. If so, I shall appreciate knowing it.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
